originalTitle: 'Half of my friends were killed' - the girls returning to a school caught up in war
title: Brave Sisters Asha and Alika Go Back to School!
content:
Hello, Friends! Meet Asha and Alika!

Hello everyone! Your friendly news reporter from Africa is here. Today, I want to tell you about two very special and very brave twin sisters. Their names are Asha and Alika. They live in a beautiful country in Africa. Asha and Alika are just like you! They love to play, laugh, and learn new things. They used to go to school every day with their friends. School was a happy place for them, full of books, games, and wonderful teachers.

A Sad Day at School

One day, something very, very sad and scary happened at their school. There were loud, booming noises. These noises were like big bangs that made the ground shake. It was not fireworks for a party. These sounds meant trouble. It was called "shelling." Shelling happens when people are fighting in a war, and they use big guns that make loud noises and send things flying through the air. It’s a very dangerous thing. Asha and Alika were very scared. Everyone ran to hide. When the loud noises stopped, they looked around. What they saw made their hearts very, very sad. Many of their friends were hurt. Some of their friends could not even go home anymore because they had been hurt so badly. It was a terrible, terrible day for Asha, Alika, and their school. They lost many of their dear friends.

Understanding War (It's Not Fun)

You might be wondering, "What is war?" Well, war is when grown-ups in different groups or countries fight each other. They use big weapons, and it makes places very unsafe. It’s not like playing games or having a small argument. War is very serious and causes a lot of hurt and sadness. It can make homes unsafe, schools close, and children unable to play outside. It's a very sad thing that happens in some parts of the world. *Did you know?* Most people in the world want peace, not war! Peace means everyone is safe, happy, and can be friends.

Why We Love School!

Even after such a scary and sad time, Asha and Alika decided to do something amazing. They decided to go back to school! Can you imagine how brave that is? School is such an important place for all children. It’s where you learn to read exciting stories, write your name, and count numbers. You learn about animals, stars, and faraway places. School is also where you meet your friends! You play games, share snacks, and learn together. Teachers are special helpers who guide you and teach you new things every day. Going to school helps you grow up to be smart, kind, and ready for big adventures in life. *Did you know?* For many children in Africa, school is their favourite place because they know learning helps them have a bright future!

Brave Hearts and Big Dreams

Asha and Alika miss their friends who were hurt or died very much. Their hearts still feel heavy sometimes when they think about what happened. But they also feel something strong inside them. It’s called "determination." Determination means you try very, very hard and you don't give up, even when things are difficult. They are determined to finish their studies. They want to learn everything they can. Asha dreams of becoming a wonderful teacher one day, helping other children learn and be happy. Alika wants to be a doctor, so she can help people who are sick or hurt. They know that by going back to school, they are honoring their friends. They are showing everyone that learning is more powerful than any fear. *Did you know?* Being determined means you keep trying, just like learning to ride a bike or tying your shoelaces!

Let's All Be Brave!

Asha and Alika are shining examples for all of us. They show us that even when bad things happen, we can find courage inside ourselves. We can choose to be strong and keep learning. Their story reminds us that every child deserves to go to school safely, to learn, and to dream big dreams. Let's all cheer for Asha and Alika! And let's remember to be kind to our friends, work hard at school, and hope for peace everywhere. Because when children learn, the world becomes a much brighter and happier place for everyone. *Did you know?* When you share what you learn with others, you help make everyone smarter and happier!
summary: Two brave twin sisters, Asha and Alika, in Africa returned to their school even after a scary event where they lost friends, showing great courage and determination to learn.
whyMatters: This is important because it shows how brave children can be, how important school is for dreams, and why we should always hope for peace so all kids can learn safely.

originalTitle: Late Romero header rescues draw for Tottenham at Burnley
title: Late Romero header rescues draw for Tottenham at Burnley
content: Cristian Romero rescues a point for Tottenham Hotspur late on just as under-pressure head coach Thomas Frank faced further embarrassment against struggling Burnley at Turf Moor.
